page.title: 09The Bell Ringers, Stoulton
page.content: A married couple who have lived in Stoulton for forty years are companologists. They provided some interesting information about the bells in their house. At the end of their house, there is an extension to provide a bell tower. He became interested in bells in 1936 when he first started ringing church bells. Then he was given two bells by a friend which developed his interest. Today, he owns ten small bells which were originally part of a carillon in Australia. His bells are usually used for a practice on Friday night by local people. They are also used for peals and family occasions, such as birthdays. He is fortunate enough to have his own foundry in the garden where he makes his own bells. Visitors have come from Australia and New Zealand to see his bells.
